item.title: Privacy - 7 - VPN Providers and India - what's going on ?
item.description:
Context

The Indian government’s cybersecurity wing is called Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In), under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY).

In April'22, CERT-In published directions to address gaps in incident analysis. Most controversially, this includes the following -

Maintenance of logs of ICT systems; subscriber/customer registrations 
details by Data centers, Virtual Private Server (VPS) providers, 
VPN Service providers

and

These directions shall enhance overall cyber security posture and 
ensure safe & trusted Internet in the country.

Due to the very concise nature of this document, CERT-In published another document in May'22 to clarify why they are asking VPN providers to share their customer details and also log all their activity.
